meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Lithuania.
meanings.sent1: In Lithuania, you can buy many things with just one litas.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my euros for litas when I visited Lithuania.
meanings.sent3: The litas in my pocket jingled happily as I walked.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a litas, bringing joy wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The litas shone brightly in the sunlight, a symbol of prosperity.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight used in ancient Rome, equal to about 72 grams.
meanings.sent1: The merchant measured the spices using a litas.
meanings.sent2: Ancient Romans used the litas to weigh precious metals.
meanings.sent3: The litas on the scale seemed to whisper secrets from the past.
meanings.sent4: His determination was as heavy as a litas, unwavering and strong.
meanings.sent5: The litas balanced delicately on the scale, a link to history.

meanings.definition: A type of fish found in the waters of the Pacific Ocean.
meanings.sent1: The litas swam gracefully among the coral reefs.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen set out early to catch the elusive litas.
meanings.sent3: The litas wore a tiny crown made of seaweed, pretending to be a king.
meanings.sent4: The litas darted through the water like a silver arrow.
meanings.sent5: Children giggled as they watched the litas play hide-and-seek.
